Key Match Events: Royals outfielder MJ Melendez ran down a line drive on the warning track with a 5% catch probability.
Royals infielder Sam Massey made a diving catch to rob former Royal Ryan O'Hearn of a run-scoring single.
Royals designated hitter Vinnie Pasquantino had an RBI single earlier in the game.
Royals superstar Bobby Witt Jr. legged out an infield single to drive home outfielder Kyle Isbel in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals went 2-5 against the Yankees this season, losing two of three games in New York from Sept. 9-11 and being outscored 14-12 in the road series.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro made a shrewd decision to turn to his bullpen and insert left-handed reliever Angel Zerpa in the high-leverage spot in the fifth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals are headed to the American League Divisional Series and will face the New York Yankees at Yankee Stadium on Saturday, Oct. 5.
The Royals swept the best-of-three AL wild-card series and will face the Yankees in the ALDS.
The Royals went 18 innings without scoring a run in the wild-card series.
